intro: Acrymia ajugiflora, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Acrymia ajugiflora is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
